About Me

Who am I?

My name is Jake Buccarelli. I live in Philadelphia, PA, and I build websites and full-stack applications. I love everything tech, and I want to share this love with the world by building beautiful, innovative user experiences. I left my career in pharmaceutical advertising to embark on this amazing journey, and after a year of intense study, consistent practice, and perfecting the art of caffination, I couldn’t be happier that I took the leap. As a lifelong techie turned freelance developer, I look forward to waking up every day to new challenges, new opportunities to learn, and new JavaScript frameworks.

Outside of programming, I enjoy travelling to new places, trying new foods, and finding the perfect coffee bean for my personal cold brew. I’m a beer snob who’s developed a fondness for IPAs and imperial stouts, and I spend too much time watching movies. A dedicated weightlifter that loves being in the gym, but also a hobbyist gamer with a soft spot for RPGs. When I'm not exploring the historic streets of Old City, Philadelphia with my girlfriend, you can find me endulging my Italian heritage with cannolis from Randazzo's, a northern New Jersey bakery from my childhood.

Pennsylvania State University

September 2012 - May 2016

Majored in Economics and minored in Business and the Liberal Arts. Also held an Executive Board position as the Sergean-at-Arms for the Delta Sigma Phi fraternity, and was a Lead Analyst in the Equities division of the Penn State Asset Management Group.

The Flatiron School

August 2017 - February 2018

Completed the Full-Stack Web Developer Program. Used JavaScript, Ruby-On-Rails, HTML/CSS, MySQL, React, and Redux to develop extensive web-based applications through a rigorous, collaborative learning and development process that was tracked using Git.

Freelance

February 2018 - Present

Freelance Web Developer looking to gain experience working with a variety of different clients. Have partnered wih a pharmaceutical advertising firm to develop custom email campaigns, and a local real estate agent to develop a personal website to cater to her specific market.
